Answer: I have a personal bias: I don‚Äôt like people who like to talk about themselves too much. To me, it suggests that they are too infatuated with themselves, and also suggests that they are not willing to listen to good advice. IMO, a person who talks little and listens carefully is much more effective because they are more aware of their own shortcomings. Modesty pays if it is genuine.For this reason,I have a personal bias: I don‚Äôt like people who like to talk about themselves too much. To me, it suggests that they are too infatuated with themselves, and also suggests that they are not willing to listen to good advice. IMO, a person who talks little and listens carefully is much more effective because they are more aware of their own shortcomings. Modesty pays if it is genuine.For this reason, I believe that Ren Zhengfei of Huawei is a much more effective leader than Jack Ma.Jack Ma started out as a marketer, and never really graduated from that to something else. He loved media attention, and especially loved to be interviewed by the US media, which has always loved billionaires who speak fluent English. Americans love success stories about how a single individual triumphed against all odds to succeed, even if it isn‚Äôt true. I believe that this fed his ego in a bad way.In contrast, Ren Zhengfei started his career in the People‚Äôs Liberation Army where he learned the value of discipline and organization. I love the way he craves learning, especially from the people who are trying to destroy him. Most recently, this has been the US government‚Äôs Commerce Department which has not missed a single opportunity to destroy Huawei, including putting his daughter, Meng Wanzhou, under house arrest in Vancouver for nearly three years. Instead of hating the US government, he has told Huawei employees that they must learn from the US, especially how the US became the leader in so many fields.One particular training method he has used is little-known in the US: it is called the Blue Army. The Blue Army is Huawei‚Äôs corporate equivalent of the US military‚Äôs aggressor squadron [1] used to train its best pilots in air-to-air combat. Have you heard of any US companies which have something similar to train their employees? I haven‚Äôt.In October 2021, Ren ...

question: https://www.quora.com/How-does-Jack-Ma-manage-a-top-technology-company-without-being-a-technology-person

Answer: Jack Ma was a visionary and consummate ‚Äúbig picture‚Äù entrepreneur. Much of his success was selling this vision to his early (as well as later) employees and inspiring them to push on with a ‚Äúmartial spirit‚Äù.Jack Ma was neither a details guy nor a technology operator ‚Äî as he himself would remind the world countless times. But from the beginning, whether it was luck or his own unique charismatic approach, he found and/or attracted the right people to fill these roles.For example, in its early days when Alibaba was nothing more than Jack Ma and an idea, he convinced Joe Tsai to leave a stable, luJack Ma was a visionary and consummate ‚Äúbig picture‚Äù entrepreneur. Much of his success was selling this vision to his early (as well as later) employees and inspiring them to push on with a ‚Äúmartial spirit‚Äù.Jack Ma was neither a details guy nor a technology operator ‚Äî as he himself would remind the world countless times. But from the beginning, whether it was luck or his own unique charismatic approach, he found and/or attracted the right people to fill these roles.For example, in its early days when Alibaba was nothing more than Jack Ma and an idea, he convinced Joe Tsai to leave a stable, lucrative job at Investor AB to join the startup. In many ways, Joe was the complete opposite of Jack Ma ‚Äî educated at a prestigious university, worked for a white-shoe law firm and respected investment firm, Taiwanese vs. mainland Chinese ‚Äî but he ultimately became one of Jack‚Äôs most important and trusted partners and a very strong complement in all aspects of running the day-to-day business as well as helping influence the long-term strategy.Similarly, he also sold his vision to the right investment partners, principally Masayoshi Son at Softbank and Jerry Yang at Yahoo. Although they did not always agree on everything, ultimately they had the long-term horizon to execute on the vision and each benefited massively as a result. Softbank‚Äôs investment in Alibaba ranks alongside Nasper‚Äôs investment in Tencent among the most successful venture investments of all time.Jack Ma was also generous with equity for his employees. Compared to other Chinese (not to mention many non-Chinese) Internet or technology companies, Alibaba was far more generous with stock options and grants. In some cases, Jack Ma shared equity from his personal ownership with employees instead of the standard practice of diluting everyone to enlarge the employee equity pool.The result was relatively broad stock ownership in Alibaba‚Äôs employee base ‚Äî and the minting of thousands of millionaires before and during the IPOMost of them ‚Äî like Jack Ma himself ‚Äî came from very ‚Äúnormal‚Äù backgrounds. While they may not have come with the most impressive educational pedigree or work experience, they learned by doing and having a front-row seat to one of the greatest stories in modern capitalism.One thing I have observed (from the outside) is that many in the original core group of Alibaba‚Äôs founders/management are still heavily involved with the firm, especially when you compare with other firms in the space. Many of these core group are in senior leadership positions running major parts of Alibaba as it has expanded into new areas over time (e.g. Lucy Peng at Ant Financial).Alibaba employees that have left often do so to pursue their own entrepreneurial ventures but still remain in the wider Alibaba alumni network and eco-system ‚Äî not dissimilar to the ‚ÄúPaypal Mafia‚ÄùIn summary, besides having the vision and focus, I think the most important things that Jack Ma did to build the company were:Jack Ma has not been involved in day-to-day operations for some time now. Yet Alibaba and its affiliates have continued to evolve and push into new areas (cloud, digital content, O2O, new retail, fintech) and ‚Äî in my view ‚Äî executed very well. So from this perspective, I think that the Alibaba management team is strong enough to continue carrying the torch and performing at a high level.Meanwhile, Jack Ma‚Äôs role as chief architect of the company‚Äôs long-term vision and its most effective spokesperson should continue whether or not he has an official role with the company.

Answer: A woman in a domestic violence situation called 911, pretending to order pizza.The dispatcher answered the call and told the woman she had dialed the incorrect number. She insisted she was through to the right person, and it was only then did he realize what was happening.Tim Teneyck had seen similar scenarios being shared on social media, but never thought he‚Äôd be in the same position today.Here's a transcript of the conversation:Mr Teneyck:Caller:Mr Teneyck:Caller:Continue ReadingA woman in a domestic violence situation called 911, pretending to order pizza.The dispatcher answered the call and told the woman she had dialed the incorrect number. She insisted she was through to the right person, and it was only then did he realize what was happening.Tim Teneyck had seen similar scenarios being shared on social media, but never thought he‚Äôd be in the same position today.Here's a transcript of the conversation:Mr Teneyck:Caller:Mr Teneyck:Caller:Mr Teneyck:Caller:Mr Teneyck:Throughout the call, the woman found methods to respond to Mr Teneyck‚Äôs yes or no questions.Mr Teneyck:Caller:Mr Teneyck:Caller:The back and forth questions worked. The perpetrator who came home intoxicated and began to behave violently, was caught and arrested.In that moment, the daughter had to think quickly to protect herself and her mother ‚Äî a hero!Mr Teneyck encouraged victims from that day onwards, to use the words ‚Äúpepperoni pizza‚Äù as a magic word if the abusive person is in close proximity, when calling 911.I can only imagine how difficult his job is. The amount of patience and emotional control a person needs for this career is admirable. He could have easily brushed it off as a prank call, but his dedication to this woman is inspiring.Sitting on the other side of the phone line, not being able to physically be there in person, but to save someone through your words requires strength.

Answer: Hey,Interesting question, I have worked in multiple industries, let me try to explain this.Simple Software Development:I am already seeing companies allowing normal people to build their own mobile apps. still a couple of years down the lane, this industry will fully be functional.Basic Business Operations:Hey,Interesting question, I have worked in multiple industries, let me try to explain this.Simple Software Development:I am already seeing companies allowing normal people to build their own mobile apps. still a couple of years down the lane, this industry will fully be functional.Basic Business Operations:I own a 10 cow dairy farm, When I pitched the idea to my farmer partner, he requested for 3 labors to take care of the farm, I bought him a milking machine, automated water supply, cutting machine, and backup generators, Now he runs it on his own. Tool & Machine will reduce labor needs.Educators & Teachers:Accounting & Money Management:Banks will be reduced to apps and tax filing will be automated (Or AI will help), Some jobs will be lost. Payment collection is almost dead, most are already paying online.Physical Store:OnlineTraditional Print Media:My marketing for the company has been completely online. All physical marketing is almost certainly going to die.Law Enforcement, Security & Defence:Defense is moving more into attack drones and unmanned guns, fewer soldiers will avoid direct conflict and use machines to fight the next battles.Medical Industry:Conclusion:I can keep writing, All I am trying to say is, World will keep evolving and jobs will keep changing some will be lost and new ones will be created.If you want to be safe in life, don‚Äôt depend on your job for very long, Try to get into financial stability as soon as possible, or have multiple skills to work in different industries as and when needed.If you can figure out basic needs like food, clothing, and shelter without depending on your job, You will be better off than many unfortunate.Hope this helpsRegards Surya Someshwara
